00073 template <class T>
00074 bool BinarySearchTree<T>::search(const T& searchItem) const
00075 {
00076         nodeType<T> * current;
00077         bool found = false;
00078 
00079         if (this->root == 0)
00080         {
00081                 cout << "Cannot search an empty tree." << endl;
00082         }
00083         else
00084         {
00085                 // Tree is not empty...
00086 
00087                 current = this->root;
00088 
00089                 while
00090                 (
00091                          (current != 0)
00092                                 &&
00093                         !(found)
00094                 )
00095                 {
00096                         // Keep searching...
00097 
00098                         if (current->data == searchItem)
00099                         {
00100                                 // Found at this node.
00101                                 found = true;
00102                         }
00103                         else if (current->data > searchItem)
00104                         {
00105                                 // Search left subtree
00106                                 current = current->left;
00107                         }
00108                         else
00109                         {
00110                                 // Search right subtree
00111                                 current = current->right;
00112                         }
00113                 }       // end while
00114         }               // end else
00115 
00116         return found;
00117 }

00128 template <class T>
00129 void BinarySearchTree<T>::insert(const T & dataToInsert)
00130 {
00131         nodeType<T> * current;                  // pointer to traverse the tree.
00132         nodeType<T> * trailCurrent;             // pointer to follow current.
00133         nodeType<T> * newNode;                  // pointer to create the node.
00134 
00135         newNode = new nodeType<T>;
00136         newNode->data = dataToInsert;
00137         newNode->left = 0;
00138         newNode->right = 0;
00139 
00140         if(this->root == 0)
00141         {
00142                 // Tree is currently empty. Make this new item the root of the tree.
00143                 this->root = newNode;
00144 
00145                 // done
00146         }
00147         else
00148         {
00149                 current = this->root; // Start at the root of the tree.
00150                 while(current != 0)
00151                 {
00152                         trailCurrent = current;
00153 
00154                         if(current->data == dataToInsert)
00155                         {
00156                                 cout << "The item to be inserted is already\n in the tree. Duplicates are not allowed!" << endl;
00157                                 return;
00158                                 // done
00159                         }
00160                         else if (current->data > dataToInsert)
00161                         {
00162                                 // Follow left subtree
00163                                 current = current->left;
00164                         }
00165                         else
00166                         {
00167                                 // Follow right subtree
00168                                 current = current->right;
00169                         }
00170                 }               // end while.
00171 
00172                 // current is now NULL. We have found the place to insert at.
00173                 // trailCurrent is the parent of this NULL.
00174 
00175                 if (trailCurrent->data > dataToInsert)
00176                 {
00177                         // Make the new node the LEFT child of trailCurrent.
00178                         trailCurrent->left = newNode;
00179                 }
00180                 else
00181                 {
00182                         // Make the new node the RIGHT child of trailCurrent.
00183                         trailCurrent->right = newNode;
00184                 }
00185         }
00186 }

00193 template <class T>
00194 void BinarySearchTree<T>::deleteFromTree(nodeType<T> * & p)
00195 {
00196         nodeType<T> * temp;                     // pointer to delete the node.
00197         nodeType<T> * predecessor;      // pointer used in CASE 4.
00198         nodeType<T> * trailCurrent;     // pointer behind predecessor.
00199 
00200         if (p == 0)
00201         {
00202                 cout << "Error: the node to be deleted is NULL." << endl;
00203         }
00204         else if(p->left == 0 && p->right == 0)
00205         {
00206 
00207                 // CASE 1
00208                 // Node to be deleted has no right or left subtree.
00209                 // Go ahead and delete the node.
00210                 temp = p;
00211                 p = 0;
00212                 delete temp;
00213         }
00214         else if(p->left == 0)
00215         {
00216 
00217                 // CASE 2
00218                 // Node to be deleted has no left subtree.
00219                 // Bypass and then delete.
00220                 temp = p;
00221                 p = temp->right; // Bypass.
00222                 delete temp;
00223         }
00224         else if(p->right == 0)
00225         {
00226 
00227                 // CASE 3
00228                 // Node to be deleted has no right subtree.
00229                 // Bypass and then delete.
00230                 temp = p;
00231                 p = temp->left; // Bypass.
00232                 delete temp;
00233         }
00234         else
00235         {
00236 
00237                 // CASE 4
00238                 // Node to be deleted has left and right subtrees.
00239                 // Find the predecessor of the node to be deleted...
00240 
00241                 // Go left.
00242                 predecessor = p->left;
00243                 trailCurrent = 0;
00244 
00245                 // Go right until null.
00246                 while (predecessor->right != 0)
00247                 {
00248                         trailCurrent = predecessor;
00249                         predecessor = predecessor->right;
00250                 }
00251 
00252                 //   predecessor->right == NULL
00253 
00254                 //   Overwrite the data of the node to be deleted,
00255                 //   "swapping" in the data of the predecessor.
00256                 p->data = predecessor->data; // Perform the "swap"
00257 
00258 
00259 
00260                 // Bypass the predecessor.
00261                 if (trailCurrent == 0)
00262                 {
00263                         // predecessor did not move.
00264                         // predecessor == p->left.
00265                         // we need to adjust p.
00266 
00267                         p -> left = predecessor -> left; // bypass predecessor
00268                 }
00269                 else
00270                 {
00271                         // predecessor has no right subtree.
00272                         // Get the left subtree of predecessor (might be NULL anyway. Does not matter)
00273                         // ...call it LS
00274                         // Set the right subtree of trailCurrent to LS.
00275                         // predecessor has now been bypassed.
00276 
00277                         trailCurrent->right = predecessor->left; // bypass predecessor
00278                 }
00279 
00280                 // Predecessor has been bypassed.
00281                 // Delete the predecessor.
00282 
00283                 delete predecessor;
00284                 predecessor = 0;
00285         }
00286 }

00294 template <class T>
00295 void BinarySearchTree<T>::deleteNode(const T & deleteItem)
00296 {
00297         nodeType<T> * current;          // pointer to traverse the tree.
00298         nodeType<T> * trailCurrent;     // pointer behind current.
00299 
00300         bool found = false;
00301 
00302         if (this->root == 0)
00303         {
00304                 // Tree is empty.
00305                 cout << "Cannot delete from an empty tree." << endl;
00306         }
00307         else
00308         {
00309                 // Tree is not empty.
00310 
00311                 current = this->root;
00312                 trailCurrent = this->root;
00313 
00314                 while
00315                 (
00316                                  current != 0
00317                                         &&
00318                                 !found
00319                 )
00320                 {
00321                         if (current -> data == deleteItem)
00322                         {
00323                                 // Found the item at this node.
00324                                 found = true;
00325                         }
00326                         else
00327                         {
00328                                 // Not equal to this node.
00329                                 // Search one of the subtrees of this node...
00330 
00331                                 trailCurrent = current;
00332 
00333                                 if (current -> data > deleteItem)
00334                                 {
00335                                         // (Current-> data) > (deleteItem)
00336                                         // Search the left subtree for deleteItem
00337                                         current = current -> left;
00338                                 }
00339                                 else
00340                                 {
00341                                         // (Current-> data) <= (deleteItem)
00342                                         // Search the right subtree for deleteItem
00343                                         current = current -> right;
00344                                 }
00345                         }
00346                 }
00347 
00348                 // current becomes null when we reach the end of a subtree without finding the item.
00349                 // found becomes true when we find the item.
00350 
00351 
00352                 if (current == 0)
00353                 {
00354                         // Searched the whole tree. Did not find the item.
00355                         cout << "The item to be deleted is not in the tree." << endl;
00356                 }
00357                 else if(found)
00358                 {
00359                         // Found the item in the tree.
00360 
00361                         if (current == this->root)
00362                         {
00363                                 // The item is at the root node of the tree.
00364                                 deleteFromTree(this->root);
00365                         }
00366                         else if (trailCurrent -> data > deleteItem)
00367                         {
00368                                 // The item was found in the tree, not at the root.
00369                                 // Current node is the LEFT subnode of trailCurrent
00370                                 deleteFromTree(trailCurrent->left); // delete current
00371                         }
00372                         else
00373                         {
00374                                 // The item was found in the tree, not at the root.
00375                                 // Current node is the RIGHT subnode of trailCurrent
00376                                 deleteFromTree(trailCurrent->right); // delete current
00377                         }
00378                 }
00379                 else
00380                 {
00381                         // How can this happen?  (found == true)  &&  (current != 0)
00382                         cout << "How can this happen? The item to be deleted is not in the tree." << endl;
00383                 }
00384         }
00385 }

00412 template <class T>
00413 void BinarySearchTree<T>::fillVectorInOrder(vector<T> & vect, nodeType<T> * p) const
00414 {
00415         if (p != 0)
00416         {
00417                 fillVectorInOrder(vect, p->left);
00418                 vect.push_back(p->data);                        // process me in the middle.
00419                 fillVectorInOrder(vect, p->right);
00420         }
00421 }
00422 
00423 
00424 
00426 template <class T>
00427 void BinarySearchTree<T>::fillVectorPreOrder(vector<T> & vect, nodeType<T> * p) const
00428 {
00429         if (p != NULL)
00430         {
00431                 vect.push_back(p->data);                        // process me first
00432                 fillVectorPreOrder(vect, p->left);
00433                 fillVectorPreOrder(vect, p->right);
00434         }
00435 }
00436 
00437 
00438 
00440 template <class T>
00441 void BinarySearchTree<T>::fillVectorPostOrder(vector<T> & vect, nodeType<T> * p) const
00442 {
00443         if (p != NULL)
00444         {
00445                 fillVectorPostOrder(vect, p->left);
00446                 fillVectorPostOrder(vect, p->right);
00447                 vect.push_back(p->data);                        // process me last
00448         }
00449 }

00460 /*
00461 // Find the maximum height of the binary tree
00462 template <class T>
00463 int BinarySearchTree<T>::maxHeight(nodeType<T> *p)
00464 {
00465         if (!p)
00466         {
00467                 return 0;
00468         }
00469 
00470         int leftHeight = maxHeight(p->left);
00471 
00472         int rightHeight = maxHeight(p->right);
00473 
00474         if (leftHeight > rightHeight)
00475         {
00476                 return leftHeight + 1;
00477         }
00478         else
00479         {
00480                 return rightHeight + 1;
00481         }
00482 }
00483 */

00497 /*
00498 // Print the arm branches (eg, /    \ ) on a line
00499 template <class T>
00500 void BinarySearchTree<T>::printBranches(
00501                                                                                 int branchLen,
00502                                                                                 int nodeSpaceLen,
00503                                                                                 int startLen,
00504                                                                                 int nodesInThisLevel,
00505                                                                                 const deque<nodeType<T>*>& nodesQueue,
00506                                                                                 ostream& out
00507                                                                         )
00508 {
00509         // Iterator for the deque of nodeType<T> pointers.
00510         deque<nodeType<T>*>::const_iterator iter = nodesQueue.begin();
00511 
00512         for (int i = 0; i < nodesInThisLevel / 2; i++)
00513         {
00514                 // Holy moly, I can't believe whoever wrote this!
00515                 out << ((i == 0) ? setw(startLen-1) : setw(nodeSpaceLen-2)) << "" << ((*iter++) ? "/" : " ");
00516                 out << setw(2*branchLen+2) << "" << ((*iter++) ? "\\" : " ");
00517         }
00518         out << endl;
00519 }
00520 */

00523 /*
00524 // Print the branches and node (eg, ___10___ )
00525 template <class T>
00526 void BinarySearchTree<T>::printNodes(
00527                                                                 int branchLen,
00528                                                                 int nodeSpaceLen,
00529                                                                 int startLen,
00530                                                                 int nodesInThisLevel,
00531                                                                 const deque<nodeType<T>*>& nodesQueue,
00532                                                                 ostream& out
00533                                                                 )
00534 {
00535         deque<nodeType<T>*>::const_iterator iter = nodesQueue.begin();
00536 
00537         for (int i = 0; i < nodesInThisLevel; i++, iter++)
00538         {
00539                 out << ((i == 0) ? setw(startLen) : setw(nodeSpaceLen)) << "" << ((*iter && (*iter)->left) ? setfill('_') : setfill(' '));
00540                 out << setw(branchLen+2) << ((*iter) ? intToString((*iter)->data) : "");
00541                 out << ((*iter && (*iter)->right) ? setfill('_') : setfill(' ')) << setw(branchLen) << "" << setfill(' ');
00542         }
00543         out << endl;
00544 }
00545 */

00551 template <class T>
00552 void BinarySearchTree<T>::printLeaves(
00553                                                                 int indentSpace,
00554                                                                 int level,
00555                                                                 int nodesInThisLevel,
00556                                                                 const deque<nodeType<T>*>& nodesQueue,
00557                                                                 ostream& out
00558                                                                 )

00573 /*
00574 // Pretty formatting of a binary tree to the output stream
00575 // @ param
00576 // level  Control how wide you want the tree to sparse (eg, level 1 has the minimum space between nodes, while level 2 has a larger space between nodes)
00577 // indentSpace  Change this to add some indent space to the left (eg, indentSpace of 0 means the lowest level of the left node will stick to the left margin)
00578 template <class T>
00579 void BinarySearchTree<T>::printPretty(ostream& out)
00580 {
00581         int level = 2;
00582         int indentSpace = 0;
00583 
00584         int h = maxHeight(root);
00585         int nodesInThisLevel = 1;
00586 
00587         int branchLen = 2*((int)pow(2.0,h)-1) - (3-level)*(int)pow(2.0,h-1);  // eq of the length of branch for each node of each level
00588         int nodeSpaceLen = 2 + (level+1)*(int)pow(2.0,h);  // distance between left neighbor node's right arm and right neighbor node's left arm
00589         int startLen = branchLen + (3-level) + indentSpace;  // starting space to the first node to print of each level (for the left most node of each level only)
00590 
00591         deque<nodeType<T>*> nodesQueue;
00592         nodesQueue.push_back(root);
00593         for (int r = 1; r < h; r++)
00594         {
00595                 printBranches(branchLen, nodeSpaceLen, startLen, nodesInThisLevel, nodesQueue, out);
00596                 branchLen = branchLen/2 - 1;
00597                 nodeSpaceLen = nodeSpaceLen/2 + 1;
00598                 startLen = branchLen + (3-level) + indentSpace;
00599                 prnodeType<T>s(branchLen, nodeSpaceLen, startLen, nodesInThisLevel, nodesQueue, out);
00600 
00601                 for (int i = 0; i < nodesInThisLevel; i++) {
00602                         nodeType<T> * currNode = nodesQueue.front();
00603                         nodesQueue.pop_front();
00604                         if (currNode) {
00605                                 nodesQueue.push_back(currNode->left);
00606                                 nodesQueue.push_back(currNode->right);
00607                         }
00608                         else
00609                         {
00610                                 nodesQueue.push_back(0);
00611                                 nodesQueue.push_back(0);
00612                         }
00613                 }
00614                 nodesInThisLevel *= 2;
00615         }
00616         printBranches(branchLen, nodeSpaceLen, startLen, nodesInThisLevel, nodesQueue, out);
00617         printLeaves(indentSpace, level, nodesInThisLevel, nodesQueue, out);
00618 }
00619 */
